whiteboard.admin

Class AdminController

  • java.lang.Object
    • whiteboard.admin.AdminController

  • @Controller
public class AdminController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class controls the data and views for the admin role's pages.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AdminController()

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String admin_home_get(java.lang.String person, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Homepage for the administrator; routed from LoginController, contigent on user's role = admin
      java.lang.String create_course_get(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Sets up the data to show the create course prompt and loads a drop down list of possible locations.

      Gets the course information entered by the user in the post submission.
      java.lang.String enroll_prof_get(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Gets the list of all courses/professors and saves it the wrapper class.
      java.lang.String enroll_prof_post(java.lang.String enroll_user, java.lang.String enroll_course, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Gets the list of professors/course enrolled and saves to the DB.

      Gets the list of all possible courses and students and adds them to the wrapper class.

      Gets the list of students/course from the post submission and saves the information to the DB.
      java.lang.String show_users_get(Person person, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Gets the list of all users from the DB and adds them to the model for viewing.

        @PostMapping(value="/admin/create_course")
public java.lang.String create_course_post(@ModelAttribute
                                                                                       Course course,
                                                                                       @RequestParam(value="location_select")
                                                                                       java.lang.String location,
                                                                                       org.springframework.ui.Model model)

        location -
        model -
        Returns:
